loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De Lambaré Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Unidas de Lambaré” se encuentra en el segundo ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, tiene 14 integrantes, de la zona de Asunción. Todas las integrantes siempre se esfuerzan al máximo para poder ayudar a sus familias y darle lo que día a día necesitan.
Lilian forma parte del grupo, y comenta que se dedica al reciclaje, como ser de cartones, plástico, hierros y demás. Ella comenta que recorre las calles en busca de plástico y de cartón, lo cual es un trabajo demasiado sacrificado. Está muy orgullosa de lo que hace, puesto que es un trabajo muy digno y por sobre todo muy honesto.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de plásticos, lo cual podrá revender y tener un margen de ganancia, lo cual le ayudará a seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia. Ella quiere que los suyos no pasen por necesidades de ningún tipo, es por ello que siempre se esfuerza al máximo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Lambaré Women United" is currently in its second cycle of the Fundacion Paraguaya's Women Entrepreneurs program. The group consists of 14 members from the area of Asunción. The members always try their best to help their families and give them what they need every day.

Lilian is part of the group and says that she has a recycling business, recycling cartons, plastic, iron and other items. She walks the streets looking for plastic and cardboard, a job which she describes as extremely demanding. She is very proud of what she does, since it is a worthy job and above all very honest.

Lilian is requesting a loan to purchase plastics, which she will resell at a profit margin, which will help her to continue working and help her family. She does not want her family to be in any kind of need, which is why she always tries her hardest.

loans.use: to purchase plastics to sell.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Cayetano” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de  Santaní. Quienes decidieron formar parte del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en equipo de todas ellas.
Lilian cría animales, como ser gallinas, cerdos, vacas, y demás tipo, lo cual le ayuda a poder mantener a su familia y darles para lo que necesitan el día a día. Ella nos comenta que su trabajo es muy arduo y sacrificado, pues es un trabajo de tiempo completo. Su meta es poder tener más animales y así crecer cada vez más.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, ya que quiere tenerlo en su stock para que no tenga ningún faltante. Ella, al igual que su grupo están muy contentas de recibir la ayuda de la fundación y de Kiva.
texts.en: The “San Cayetano” committee was formed by the union of several neighbors in the city of Santani who decided to be part of the program for entrepreneurial women of the Paraguayan Foundation to be able to help their families through team work. Lilian raises livestock, such as chicken, pigs, cows and other, this helps her support her family and provide for their day to day needs.  She indicates that her work is very hard and requires sacrifices because it's a full time job.  Her goal is to be able to have more livestock so she can grow more.  She requests a loan to buy feed for her livestock and have some in stock so that she doesn't run out. Her and her group are very happy to be helped by the Foundation and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy feed for livestock.

loans.name: Cristo Es Vida Group

texts.es: El Sr. Solio de 43 años de edad, es soltero y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 aún dependen de él. Tiene 4 años como cliente de Edaprospo y se dedica al servicio de transporte urbano, negocio con el cual lleva más de 12 años. Comenzó a raíz de poder dar una buena educación a sus hijos y obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades. Actualmente su ingreso lo destina a cubrir los gastos de alimentación, luz, agua y teléfono. Su plan para el futuro es seguir creciendo con la compra de más autos para su negocio. Él crédito se destinará a la compra de repuestos para reparar su auto, ya que se le averió algunas piezas. Solio pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Cristo es Vida”, el cual tiene 4 años desde que se formó. Solio ingresó recién como presidente del grupo, el cual está conformado por 7 personas. En la fotografía es el que esta en pie con camisa blanca.
texts.en:
Solio, 43, is single and has three children two of which still depend on him.  He’s been an Edaprospo client for four years.  He provides urban transportation service, a business he’s been in for 12 years.  He started out because he wanted to give his children a good education and earn better income to cover needs.  

He currently spends his income on food, electricity, water and telephone.  His plan for the future is to continue growing and purchasing more cars for his business.  He used the loan to buy some spare parts for his car because some of the parts broke.  

Solio belongs to the “Cristo es Vida’ (Christ is Life) communal bank which has been in operation for four years.  Solio recently became group president and there are 7 members.

loans.use: to buy tools for his car.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres trabajadoras es el grupo de la ciudad de Villa Elisa formado por 12 mujeres. El grupo lleva este nombre pues las miembros son mujeres muy trabajadoras, que día a día trabajan mucho por darle lo mejor a sus familias y de esa forma evitar que tengan que pasar por privaciones.
Eliodora es una persona muy sacrificada y trabajadora, nos comenta que se dedica al reciclado de productos de todo tipo, como ser cartones, plásticos, metales y demás tipos de materiales.  Nos cuenta que es un trabajo muy sacrificado, ya que ella recorre por las calles juntando estos materiales, esto hace todos los días. Ella está muy orgullosa de lo que hace, pues es un trabajo digno y honesto.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de plásticos y cartones en cantidad, lo que revenderá y de esa forma tendrá un poco más de ingresos, con lo cual podrá seguir manteniendo a su familia
texts.en:
"Mujeres trabajadoras" (Hard-working Women), is the communal bank in the city of Villa Elisa, made up of 12 women. The group bears this name, as the members are very hard-working women, who work hard day after day to give the best to their families, and that way avoid their having to suffer hardship. 

Eliodora is a very self-sacrificing and hard-working individual. She tells us that she recycles all types of products, including cardboard, plastic items, metals, and other types of materials. She says that this is very hard work, as she goes through the streets gathering these materials, and does this every day. 

She is very proud of what she does, as it is decent and honest work. She is applying for the loan in order to buy plastic items and cardboard in quantity, which she will resell. That way she will have a bit more income, enabling her to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: To buy plastic items and cardboard in quantity for sale.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Isla Umbugua Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre kuña Guapa Isla Umbugua se conformó en el año 2011, están en el 2do ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta  para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar económicamente a sus familias.
Esta es la historia de Sra. Victorina quien se dedica a la venta de ropas, y también tiene un kiosko con venta de comidas y bebidas y nos comenta que ella mantiene la casa, ya que enviudo hace dos años y toda la carga es solo de ella. Desea seguir trabajando para poder ayudar a su familia con el día a día.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y de esa forma tener mayor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientas. Ella esta agradecida por la ayuda que está recibiendo, pues le será muy útil.
texts.en:
The  "Kuña Guapa Isla Umbugua" women's communal bank was formed in 2011. They are in their second loan cycle, working jointly and supportively in the program. In addition to the work that each does independently, they also carry out activities jointly, in order to raise monies with the aim of having a capital fund within the group. At the same time they help one another to attain their objective, which is to work to support their families financially. 

This is Victorina's story: She sells clothing, and also has a stand selling food and drinks. She tells us that she supports the household, as she became a widow two years ago, and she alone has all the responsibility. She wishes to keep working so that she can help her family with day-to-day expenses. 

She is applying for the loan in order to buy clothing, enabling her to stock up, and that way have more variety to offer her customers. She is grateful for the help she is receiving, as it will be very useful to her.

loans.use: To buy clothing for sale.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa de 33 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 3 años con Edaprospo. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general como gaseosa, detergente, azúcar, etc. con el cual tiene 1 año de experiencia  en este negocio y comenzó gracias a la ayuda de su hermana quien le presto una parte del capital que necesitaba. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha podido ayudar a sus padres con algunos gastos. Actualmente su ingreso lo destina a cubrir los gastos de alimentación, agua, luz y teléfono. Su plan para el futuro es tener un negocio mucho  más grande y con más variedades de productos, también construir su casa. Usó el crédito en la compra de mercadería. Rosa pertenece a la alcancía comunal “El Progreso”, el cual está conformado por 7 personas. Ella leva el cargo de presidenta desde hace 1 año.
texts.en: Rosa is 33 years old. She is single and has been working with Edaprospo for 3 years. She sells grocery items such as soft drinks, detergent, sugar, etc. She has 1 year of experience in this business and she started it thanks to the help of her sister, who lent her a part of the capital that she needed. With effort and work she has been able to help her parents with some expenses. Currently her income goes to paying the costs of food, water, electricity and the telephone. Her plan for the future is to have a much larger business with a greater variety of products, and also to build her house. She used the loan to buy merchandise. Rosa belongs to the “El Progreso” communal bank, which is made up of 7 people. She has held the position of president for 1 year.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar, de 29 años de edad, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos a quienes les brinda amor y desean tener una buena calidad de vida. Oscar, es un joven muy propuesto a enfrentar las cosas de la vida; desde muy pequeño sus padres le enseñaron el trabajo en los campos y ahora desde hace 06 años logra trabajar sus tierras para cultivar plantas de cacao, palillo y plantas de frutas. Desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana se dirige a su centro de trabajo que es en los campos de cultivo donde realiza los cuidados  de sus plantas para que las plagas no logren dañar su producción. En los tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros quienes le ayuden a coger sus frutos entre risas  y conversaciones para no estar aburridos ni mucho menos cansados; después los lleva a vender a los centros de acopio de su comunidad donde le pagan muy bien; es así que Oscar logra solventar los gastos de su familia ya a ellos desea darles lo mejor. Asimismo, acude a las oficinas de MFP para poder solicitar un préstamo que ayude con sus planes de trabajo y pueda salir adelante. Este es su préstamo numero 01 con MFP, se siente muy contento con este apoyo que le dan y se compromete a ser muy puntual con sus cuotas de pago, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito mas adelante. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles comprará plantas de café para poder sembrar en su parcela.
texts.en:
Oscar, 29, lives in his own house with his wife and two children that he loves and wants them to have a good quality of life.  Oscar is a young man who is very determined to face the vicissitudes of life.  

Since he was a little boy his parents taught him how to work in the fields and now for the last six years he’s been working his land to grow cocoa beans, “palillo’ [Peruvian plant similar to the guava-tree], and fruit trees.  

He heads out to his fields very early in the morning to care for his plants so that infestations don’t damage them.  During harvest time he gets help from day laborers who help him pick fruit amid laughter and conversation so that they don’t become bored or, even worse, tired.  After, it’s sold to the local gathering centers where he’s paid very well.  

This is how Oscar manages to cover his family’s expenses since he wants to give them the best.  Therefore, he’s calling on the MFP offices to ask for a loan that will help him reach his work plans and get ahead.  

This is loan #1 with MFP and he feels very happy for the support he’s being given and commits to being a very punctual person with his payments because he wants to access another loan later on.  He will use the 2000 new soles to buy coffee plants to plant on his parcel.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy mobile phones and accessories for mobile shop business

loans.name: Natalina

texts.en:
Natalina lives in Buluk.  She sells fish, and has been in business for four years.  She is 32 years old, married, and has three children; all of them are still in school.  

Natalina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her second loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 2000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for more cell phone minutes refills to sell

loans.name: Luz Eliana

texts.es: Luz es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva, tiene 29 años, se dedica a la venta de comida, es madre de 2 hijos y es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 2 años, lo que le gusta es el ahorro, ella ahora ve que su negocio esta creciendo, ha aprendido a ser mas responsable, ahora desea seguir trabajando para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, azucar, leche y aceite.
texts.en: Luz is a member of the Agua Viva (Living Water), she is 29 years old, she has 2 children and she sell meals. She has been a member of Finca Peru for 2 years, and what she likes the most are the savings. She sees that her activity is now growing, she has learned to be more responsible, and she now wants to keep on working in order to provide for her children. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and oil.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and oil

loans.name: Padi 1 Group

texts.en:
Anah, pictured second from the left with her daughter standing in front of her, has been selling pop ice (a kind of Indonesian soft drink with a variety of flavors) for more than two years. She sells pop ice in front of her house and most of her customers are children and teenagers. Her husband is a fire fighter. Her business is running well especially at midday and at noon when the weather is a bit hot. When there is rain, only a few people will buy pop ice. 

Anah has three daughters and the older one is at school. Now she plans to use her part of the loan to expand her sales volume and add more variation in serving pop ice. In the future she wants to expand her pop ice business and hopes she can add other things to sell.

loans.use: to pay for more pop ice to sell

loans.name: Padi 2 Group

texts.en:
Susiani, pictured wearing a brown veil holding a light brown envelope, has two children. The older works as a laborer in a factory and the younger is still at school. She has been selling clothes on credit for four years. She brings clothes to the factory where her daughter works and sells them on credit. Her business is going well and she has a lot of customers who give her special orders. 

Now she is taking out a second loan from VisionFund Indonesia to help her to buy clothes that were ordered by her customers. In the future she hopes she can increase her sales volume and she can send her younger child to university. One problem that she faces in this business is when her customers are late to repay their credit.

Other group members sell flowers, snacks and daily basic needs.

loans.use: to pay for more clothes to sell on credit

loans.name: Teodota

texts.en:
Teodota is a hard-working mother with two children attending school. She operates a small store in order to generate additional income for the family. She usually earn about P7,000 each month. 

She is now asking for a loan of P8,000 to buy more grocery items to sell such as noodles, canned goods, eggs and bread. 

In the future, Teodota would like to increase her sales so that she will continuously provide a good education to her children, as the only legacy she could pass unto them.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell such as noodles, canned goods, eggs and bread to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Yei. She sells clothes and has been in business for four years. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Betty heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her forth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Ángel, un joven de 20 años, es responsable y trabajador; él junto a su hermano viven en la propia casa de su querida madre a quien le brindan amor y gratitud por darles lo mejor. La actividad que realiza Ángel, es de mucho empeño; él desde muy temprano se dirige a su campo de cultivo junto a su hermano, ambos se encargan de ver la producción de sus plantas de cacao que sus padres lograron tener durante años anteriores. Desde más de 12 años siempre está al pendiente de sus plantas para que en los tiempos de cosecha le rinda una buena obtención de frutos para llevarlas a comercializar a los centros  de acopio de su localidad. El centro de acopio donde recurre Ángel, es muy confiable ya que siempre ha llevado sus cosechas porque ahí le remuneran muy bien por cada kilo de cacao que vende. Su plan a futuro es poder estudiar y  tener una mejor calidad de vida; pero por ahora su prioridad es ver el avance de su cultivo para seguir obteniendo grandes cosechas, de esa manera lograr tener una buena economía para lograr conseguir su objetivo. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP; y se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago. Asimismo agradece a los socios de su banco comunal por permitirles ser parte de ello. Con el préstamo solicitado de 1.500 nuevos soles, comprará abono y otros agroquímicos para mantener fuertes a su siembra.
texts.en:
Ángel, 20, is a responsible, hardworking young man.  He and his brother live in their mother’s house that they love and are grateful to for giving them all the best.  

The activity that Ángel carries out is very demanding.  He heads out to his field with his brother very early and the two of them take care of the cocoa bean crops their parents managed to attain years ago.  He’s been watching over his plants for more than 12 years so that at harvest time they will produce good fruit to sell to the local gathering centers.  The gathering center Ángel goes to is very trustworthy since he’s always taken his crops there and they pay well for each kilogram of cocoa beans he sells.  His plan for the future is to study in order to have a better quality of life but for now his priority is to see his crops advance in order to continue obtaining great harvests and attaining a good economy to reach his objective.  

This will be loan #1 with MFP and he commits to being punctual with his installment payments.  He also thanks the members of his communal bank for allowing him to be part of it.  He will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy manure and other agrochemicals to keep his crops healthy.

loans.use: to buy manure and agrochemical products.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: Sergio es un hombre muy responsable, tiene 45 años de edad y su motivo por salir adelante es por su único hijo Walter de 16 años; ambos viven en su propia casa. La labor que realiza Sergio, es a la compra y venta de artefactos; esta actividad lo realiza hace mas de 20 años y comenta que siempre le ha ido muy bien en sus ventas. Sergio en sus tiempos libres se dirige a ver la producción de su campo de cultivo que su padre le heredo y con las ventas de su cosecha, compra electrodomésticos como: licuadora, plancha. Televisor, etc. Esta labor mayormente lo hace cuando sus clientes le llegan a pedir para poder comprarle. Sergio, es un hombre decido por lo tanto su mayor anhelo es que su hijo sea todo un profesional. Pero por el momento su prioridad es comprar los artefactos que sus clientes le piden. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP; y sabe que si es puntual pues puede acceder a otro crédito. En su banco comunal es un miembro de la junta directiva, el cual agradece a sus compañeros por haberle elegido. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles aunado a sus ganancias de su cosecha comprará algunos artefactos para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sergio is a very responsible man.  He’s 45 years old and his only son, 16 year old Walter, is his motivation to get ahead.  They live together in a home of their own.  Sergio buys and sells things and has been doing so for 20 years.  He tells us that things have always gone well with his sales.  In his spare time he checks the production on the land that he inherited from his father.  He uses the profits from the sale of the harvest to buy small appliances, such as blenders, irons, televisions, etc.  He does this when he gets requests from customers.

Sergio’s greatest desire is for his son to establish himself in a professional career.  His immediate goal is to buy the things that his customers have requested.  This will be his first loan through MFP and he knows that he will be able to obtain others if he repays this one on time.  He’s a member of the board of directors of his communal bank and he appreciates his fellow members for having elected him.  He will use the 1,000 PEN, along with his profits from the harvest, to buy some items for his customers.

loans.use: to fill customer orders for small appliances.

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, por la variedad de su fauna y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. Aquí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor.
 
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo que en la actualidad tiene 19 años de edad y estudia en la universidad.
 
Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que para sacara adelante a su hijo y para que no le faltara nada, hace más de 10 años y con lo que tenia pudo adecuar un local en su casa y surtir una pequeña tienda, la misma que con la ayuda de los créditos recibidos ha podido ir ampliando, tiene de todo para cubrir con las necesidades de sus clientes que son lo más importante para ella, en su local también vende artículos de bazar y otros para el hogar como platos, ollas, planchas, entre otros artículos, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 19h00 y su hijo le ayuda en su negocio cuando puede.

Este crédito es para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, atún y otros artículos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace mas de 5 años y le gusta porque le han ayudado a pesar de estar sola.
 
Su sueño es que su hijo termine sus estudios.
texts.en:
In Manabí Province’s 24 de Mayo Canton known for its beautiful scenery, forests and variety of fauna and for its hardworking residents who are farmers and raise animals, the “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” (Mother For A Better Future) communal bank meets every fifteen days.

María, 47, lives here.  She’s a single mother of a son who is 19 years old at present and attends university.

She is a very tenacious woman who in order to support her son and insure that he has everything he needs ten years ago used everything she had to set up a locale at home as a small store which with help from loans received has been able to expand.  She stocks everything necessary to cover her customers’ needs; this is what’s most important for her.  She also sells other household items in her store like dishes, pots and irons, among other items.  She works every day from 6am until 7pm and her son helps out in the store whenever he can.

This loan is to buy rice, sugar, oil, tuna and other basic staple items.  She’s been in the communal bank for over five years and likes it because they’ve helped her even though she’s alone.  Her dream is that her son completes his studies.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, tuna and other basic staple items.

loans.name: Atilio

texts.es: Atilio, de 32 años; padre de 02 hermosos hijos Yulisa de 11 años y Jerónimo de 01 año y  esposo de Agustina de 29 años; juntos  residen en su propia casa donde reina la felicidad. Desde muy temprano Atilio, se dirige a su campo de cultivo para  ver el crecimiento y avance de sus plantones de cacao que con mucho esmero logró obtener; esta actividad empezó a realizar durante 12 años y comenta que no lo ha logrado tan fácil  ya que tuvo que pasar por muchas cosas para lograr obtener lo que ahora tiene. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que gracias a las cosechas que obtiene puede solventar los gastos de su familia; sin embargo le es difícil en temporadas de lluvia porque es donde no puede ver el avance ni mucho menos realizar el desmonte que aquejan su producción. Con el tiempo quiere obtener grandes producciones, cultivando más plantas de cacao para que de esa manera llegue tener una buena economía y velar por su familia.  Pero por el momento su mayor prioridad es mantener sanos a sus siembras. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP, se siente contento por el apoyo que le brindan ya que de esa manera logrará cumplir con sus objetivos. Asimismo se compromete a ser muy puntual con sus cuotas de pago y no hacer quedar mal a sus compañeros de su banco comunal. Con los 1.500 nuevos soles podrá comprar funguicidas naturales para realizar el mantenimiento de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Atilio, 32, is the father of two beautiful children: Yulisa, 11, and Jerónimo, 1, and husband of Agustina, 29.  They live together in their own house where happiness reigns.  

Atilio heads out to his fields very early to check on his cocoa bean plants’ growth and development which he attains with much dedication.  He started this activity 12 years ago and comments that it’s not been easy because he had to go through a lot to obtain what he now has.  What he likes best about his work is that thanks to the harvests he obtains he’s able to cover his family’s expenses.  

However, it is difficult during the rainy season because he can’t see the advance or even worse is unable to clear out the weeds that invade his plants.  In time he wants to obtain great harvests cultivating more cocoa bean plants so that he can obtain a better economy and watch over his family.   But for now, his greatest priority is to keep his crops healthy.

This will be loan #1 with MFP.  He feels happy for the support he’s being given because he will be able to reach his objectives.  He also commits to being very punctual with his installment payments and not disappoint his fellow communal bank members.  He will use the 1500 new soles to buy natural fungicides for crop maintenance.

loans.use: to buy fungicide.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es: Juanita, de 34 años de edad; es una mujer que convive en su propia casa con Peter de 39 años  y sus 03 hijos a quienes desea brindarles un buen bienestar. Juanita, es una mujer de mucha labor siempre esta activa en el negocio que pueda ser rentable para ella y su familia; es por eso que vio por conveniente laborar vendiendo todo tipo de bebidas en su propia casa. Ahora ella ofrece: gaseosas, refrescos, entre otros. Comenta además que le va muy bien con sus ventas ya que sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y personas que van a visitar su localidad. Ella siempre empieza a laborar desde muy temprano pero hay más ventas a partir del medio día, sobre todo cuando hace mucho calor.  Con el crédito solicitado piensa en incrementar más productos bebibles para su clientela y de esa forma llegar abastecer su tienda. Este será un préstamo número 01 con MFP, y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindando; al igual que agradece a su banco comunal por permitirle trabajar con ellos. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles comprará: gaseosas y algunas frutas para que pueda preparar todo tipo de refrescos de las que ofrece.
texts.en:
Juanita, 34, is a woman who lives in her own house with Peter, 39, and their three children who she wants to provide wellbeing for.  Juanita is a woman who is very hardworking.  She’s always active in her business that’s profitable for her and her family.  Because of this she decided it would be useful to work selling all types of beverages at home.  

She offers soft-drinks and refreshments, among others.  She comments that she does well with her sales because her main customers are her neighbors and people who visit her locality.  She always starts work very early but most of the sales occur after noon especially when it’s very hot.  

She plans to use the requested loan to increase her stock of drinkable products for her customers so that she can stock her store.  This will be loan #1 with MFP and she feels happy for the support provided.  

She thanks her communal bank for allowing her to work with them.  She will use the 1000 new soles to buy soft-drinks and some fruit to make the various types of beverages she offers.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks and fruit.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia de 34 años de edad convive con Máximo de 35 años con quien tiene 3 hijos,  ellos viven en el centro poblado de Omaya del distrito de Pichari. Delia, es una mujer con muchos deseos de superación, cuenta que desde muy niña siempre soñaba con tenerlo todo, pero para lograr ese anhelo ella tiene que trabajar muy arduamente. Es por esta razón que ella continua incrementando sus plantaciones de cacao juntamente con su querido esposo quien es el encargado de velar los trabajos mas pesados como el sacar la maleza que crece entre sus plantas. Delia está feliz con el trabajo que realiza en su parcela agrícola por que sus plantaciones de cacao tienen un rendimiento óptimo por el que le genera un buen ingreso económico rentable.
Delia promete seguir cultivando sus plantaciones de cacao con la finalidad de obtener mejores cosechas. 
Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles comprará sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Delia is 34 years old, and lives with Máximo, aged 35, with whom she has three children.  They live in the town of Omaya in the district of Pichari.

Delia is a woman with great desire to get succeed.  Since she was a very young girl, she has always dreamed of having it all, but in order to achieve this desire, she has to work very hard.  It is for this reason that she continues to increase her cocoa plantations which she manages together with her dear husband, who takes on the heaviest work such as pulling out the weeds that grow between the plants.

Delia is happy with the work that she does on her parcel of farmland, because her cocoa plantations have great yield, which generates her a good profitable income.

Delia promises to keep on cultivating her cocoa plantations, with the end-goal of getting better harvests.

This is her first loan with MFP, and she commits to making her repayments punctually.  With the 1,000 new soles, she will purchase sacks of manure.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of manure.

loans.name: Sidney

texts.es: Sidney  de 20 años de edad, soltera vive junto en la casa de su querida mama ubicado en el centro poblado de Omaya del distrito de Pichari. Sidney es una joven emprendedora dedicado a la compra y venta de verduras en el mercado de su ciudad, actividad que lo realiza desde hace dos años y medio. Empezó trabajando con su querida madre hasta que decidió independizarse y generar su propio ingreso. Como ya tenía experiencia en el negocio le fue muy fácil continuar en el negocio, sin embargo los productos que vende tiene que traerlos desde la provincia de huamanga y el costo del flete es muy elevado pero a pesar de ello siempre le queda la ganancia. Sidney trabaja con la ayuda de su hermanita quien se queda za cuidar la tienda cuando ella viaja a realizar sus compras. Mas adelante está pensando comprarse una camioneta con la finalidad de poder aminorar sus gastos del flete. Sidney está contenta con su negocio por que le genera buenas ganancias. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles incrementará su mercadería.
texts.en:
Sidney, 20, is single living in her beloved mother’s house located in the center of the Omaya settlement in Pichari District.  Sidney is a young entrepreneur who buys and sells vegetables in her city’s market, an activity she’s been doing for two and a half years.  She started out working with her beloved mother until she decided to go out on her own and earn her own income.  Since she already had experience in this business it was very easy for her to continue with it.  

However, she brings the items she sells from the province of Huamanga and shipping costs are very high.  Despite that, however, she still earns profits.  Sidney works with help from her little sister who stays to watch over the store when she goes out to do her purchases.  Later on she plans to buy a pick-up truck in order to lessen shipping costs.  

Sidney is happy with her business that generates good profits.  This is her first loan with MFP so she commits to make her installment payments punctually.  She will use the 1000 new soles to increase her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in kator. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for two years. She is 27 years old, married, and has one child; the child is in school. 

Christine heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her child.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa de 24 años de edad, soltera ella vive en la casa de su querida madre en el centro poblado de Omaya del distrito de Pichari. Rosa es una joven dedicado a la venta de prendas de vestir en la localidad de Omaya desde ya hace 3 años atrás. Cuenta  que antes de dedicarse a éste negocio apoyaba a su querida madre en la venta de abarrotes en donde adquirió experiencia para los negocios. Es por esta razón que no se dificulta en la atención al cliente. Las prendas que vende los adquiere desde la capital, Lima, en donde tiene proveedores quienes le abastecen de acuerdo a los pedidos que rosa pudiera tener. Al inicio realizaba sus ventas de manera ambulante ya sea en las ferias de su localidad o los días domingos en el mercado. Ahora tiene un puesto alquilado en el mercado en donde ofrece sus prendas pero aún continua saliendo a las comunidades cercanas llevando sus productos hacia donde están sus asiduos clientes. Rosa está contenta con esta labor que realiza por que le genera un buen ingreso económico gracias al esfuerzo que le pone en sus ventas diarias, más adelante está pensando continuar con el negocio que tiene. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles comprara más prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Rosa is 24 years old, single, and lives in her beloved mother's home in the town of Omaya, in the Pichari district. Rosa is a young woman who has been working selling articles of clothing in the town of Omaya for three years now. She tells us that before she started this business she supported her mother in selling groceries, where she gained business experience. For this reason she has no difficulties in serving customers.

The articles that she sells are acquired in the capital, Lima, where she has providers who supply her in accordance with the orders she may have. In the beginning she made her sales by going around to street fairs in her town or on Sundays in the market. Now she has a rented stall in the market where she offers her wares, but she still goes out to the nearby communities, taking her products to where her regular customers are.

Rosa is happy with this work that she carries out because it generates a good financial income thanks to the effort she puts into her daily sales. Going forward, she is thinking of continuing with the business that she has. This is her first loan through MFP, which is why she has committed to settling her repayments punctually. With the 1,000 Nuevos Soles she will buy more articles of clothing.

loans.use: to buy more articles of clothing.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in kator. She sells at a food stall, and has been in the business for two years. She is 34 years old, married, and has five children; all of them are still in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase onions and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Jacklin

texts.en:
Jacklin lives in kator. She sells at a food stall, and has been in the business for two years. She is 23 years old, married, and has no children.

Jacklin heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase onions and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 42 years of age and is married. Her husband is a government employee in the Philippines. They are blessed with three children and all are going to school.

Marilou was a teacher of nursery students for three years. When she stopped teaching, she decided to put up a business. She started selling school supplies in the market. When she gets tired of traveling, because their house is too far from the market, she decided to start up a sari-sari store business in their village. She sells grocery items like eggs, canned goods, vinegar, powdered juice and lard. She is happy because she now has had 17 years in the business.

Marilou wishes to gain higher income from the business. She wants to extend the products she offers to her customers. Marilou is asking for a loan of PHP50,000 to buy additional groceries to sell like soap, shampoo, spices, beverages and toothpaste. She hopes to attain her wish and make it a reality.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell like soap, shampoo, spices, beverages and toothpaste.

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her dairy business. with the loan investment, she will buy a buffalo that will allow her to get a larger quantity of milk and sell it for extra income.

Surriya sells good quality milk to her clients, that’s why her customers are increasing constantly. She is confident that by purchasing another buffalo, she will be able to fulfill the demands of her customers and make more profits.

Surriya's husband operates a shuttering business in the market. Surriya has given birth to 5 children. Her eldest son works with his father while her 2 younger children are studying. She is confident about her business success in the future, after investing the loan.

loans.use: to buy buffalo for a dairy business.

loans.name: Clelia

texts.es: Clelia, de 50 años, vive con sus 2 hijos y sus padres en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Bolognesi.  Desde hace 4 años decidió generar su propia fuente de trabajo. Fue así que compró una fotocopiadora  en un pequeño espacio que alquilo en el centro de la ciudad, muy  cercana a varias instituciones educativas  en donde tiene más afluencia de clientes.  Todas las mañanas se dirige  a su espacio para dedicarse a sacar copias de los pedidos que le hacen, de esta manera consigue las rentas necesarias de cada día para su familia, en algunas ocasiones sus hijos la apoyan, afirma que lo que le agrada de su trabajo es que es por horas y además de ser muy rentables  aunque en algunas ocasiones su máquina requiere de  mantenimiento mecánico que puede retrasarse en varios días, su meta es tener  una maquina más  efectiva  que le permita ahorrar el tiempo en  el servicio de fotocopiado que brinda. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Nueva Vida” y este es el décimo crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación pues son personas responsables y solidarias. Clelia, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de hojas bond por paquetes de millares y abastecimiento de toner (tinta) para su equipo.
texts.en:
Clelia, who is 50 years old, lives with her 2 sons and her parents in her own house, located in the Bolognesi region. 

Four years ago, she decided to generate her own source of work. Thus, she bought a photocopier in a small locale that she rents in the centre of the city, a spot very close to several educational institutions, where she larger flow of customers. Every morning, she goes to her locale to make copies according to the orders they make. This is how she obtains the necessary everyday resources for her family and sometimes, her sons help her. 

She says that what she likes about her job is that it is an hourly one and highly profitable. However, on some occasions, her machine needs mechanical maintenance, which can take several days to be completed. Her goal is to acquire a more effective machine that would enable her to save time in the photocopying service she provides. 

She belongs to the solidarity group 'Nueva Vida' and this is the tenth loan with MFP where she feels empowered because she obtains help to make progress with her business. That is why she promises to be punctual in making her payments. Moreover, she likes working in her group because the members are responsible and supportive. Upon receiving her loan, Clelia will invest the money requested into the purchase of reams of one thousand units of Bond paper as well as toner supplies (ink) for her equipment.

loans.use: to buy reams of one thousand units of paper as well as ink.

loans.name: Iris

texts.en:
Iris is in her early 30s and single. She has spent some time working as a museum docent, but has primarily focused on teaching third grade students for the past three years. At the same time, Iris continues her studies in accounting at the university.

Iris is requesting a loan in order to help pay for her tuition. Her dream is to open an accounting studio, as well as a primary school.

Iris is a member of the village bank "Los Diamantes" in Cusco, which is receiving its 16th loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to help pay for her university.

loans.name: Ericka Delfina

texts.en:
Ericka continues working in a bakery with her father, where she has about four years of experience. Mostly, the bakery concentrates on selling bread. However, Ericka also makes cakes when her customers order them. Ericka has a very early workday, which starts at 2 a.m. and ends at 8 a.m. She has to rise early in order to prepare the dough and have fresh, hot bread ready for customers in the morning. Ericka is 27 years old and has two children ages 4 and 7 with her partner.

Ericka is requesting a loan to buy raw materials such as flour, sugar, eggs, milk, and yeast. Her dream is to open a larger bakery with modern equipment. For example, she currently uses a wood-fire oven, and she would like to have an electric oven and glass display cases to show her bread.

Ericka is a member of the village bank "El Amanecer" in Cusco, which is receiving its 22nd loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, eggs, milk, and yeast to bake bread

loans.name: Donato

texts.en:
Donato is a carpenter and has had his own workshop for about three or four years. He makes wooden furniture, such as cabinets and beds, which he then sells in local markets. Donato is 34 years old and lives with his partner and two children ages six and 10.  He is requesting a loan to purchase finishing materials such as lacquer and wood stain. His dream is to buy a house of his own.

Donato is receiving a new individual loan as a member of the village bank "El Amanecer" in Cusco, which is in its 22nd cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy wood finishing material such as lacquer and wood stains

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 29 years old and lives with her partner and her 9-month-old son. For the past year, Violeta has run a small grocery store inside her father’s house. Violeta also works managing freight transport for a large Peruvian company. She is requesting a loan to increase her merchandise, such as beer, soda, rice, and sugar. Her dream is to open a large supermarket in the future.

Violeta is receiving a new individual loan as a member of the village bank "Prosperidad" in Cusco, which is in its 16th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as beer, soda, rice, and sugar

loans.name: La Cumbre Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria es casada, tiene 32 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos 3 de los cuales están estudiando,  se dedica a la crianza de animales domésticos, inició  este negocio criando gallinas ponedoras y hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara apara la compra de cerdos, ya que quiere tener una granja de cerditos y poder criarlos, para mejorar sus ingresos cuando los cerditos hayan crecido. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la venta de abarrotes, crianza de animales, y  a la venta de refacciones.
texts.en:
Maria 32 years old and married. She did not have the opportunity to study and has 5 children, 3 of whom are studying. She raises farm animals, having started this business raising egg-laying hens, and she now has 6 years of experience.

She puts together a group in order to request a loan that she will use to buy pigs, since she wants to have a farm of piglets and be able to raise them, so as to increase her income once the piglets have grown. 

The other members of the group sell groceries, raise animals and sell snacks.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru:
Гульмире 47 лет, воспитала 4 детей. С 2007 года Гульмира занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 50,000 сом (KGS). В настоящее время в хозяйстве Гульмиры имеется   4 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 10 овец и 12 коз, что позволяет иметь ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 4,000 сом от продажи молока.   Также Гульмира выращивает картофель, заготовив на сегодняшний день 3  тонны для реализации весной.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульмира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп скота - молодняка.  Доходы от кредита Гульмира планирует вложить в посадку каротофеля.
texts.en: Gulmira is 47 years old and raised four children.  She has been involved in animal husbandry since 2007, having started this business with an initial amount of 50,000 som (KGS).  At the present time, Gulmira's business contains 4 dairy cows, 2 horses, 10 sheep and 12 goats, allowing her to have a monthly profit of 4,000 som from sales of milk.  Gulmira also grows potatoes, having prepared 3 tons today for sale in the spring.  In order to further develop her business, Gulmira requested a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy young livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into planting potatoes.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia de 27 años de edad, madre soltera quien tiene un hijo con el que vive en su casa propia ubicado en el centro poblado de Omaya del distrito de Pichari. Sonia, es vendedora de productos de primera necesidad en su propia tienda, actividad que lo realiza desde hace 5 años atrás. Ella cuenta que no fue tan fácil empezar con este negocio por que no contaba con suficiente capital ya que ella se dedicaba al trabajo en la agricultura juntamente como jornalero, percibiendo un mínimo salario sin llegar alcanzarle para costear la educación de su hijo.  Es por esta razón que un hermano suyo le facilito un préstamo con el que Sonia abrió su pequeña tienda de abarrotes y poco a poco fue creciendo gracias a la dedicación y esmero que tiene. Actualmene Sonia se ha superado con su negocio, pues su tienda esta muy bien abastecida de productos de primera necesidad que hacen que todos sus clientes encuentren de todo. Más adelante está pensando seguir incrementando su negocio. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas.
Sonia está alegre por tener un banco comunal bien unido. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles incrementará su mercadería.
texts.en:
Sonia is 27 years old, and a single mother who lives with her son in her own house located in the town of Omaya in the district of Pichari. Sonia sells products that are basic necessities in her own store, which she has been doing for five years. She tells us that it wasn't very easy starting this business because she didn't have enough capital since she was working as a day laborer in agriculture, receiving minimum wage without being able to finance her son's education. It is for this reason that a brother of hers helped her get a loan which Sonia used to open her small general store. Little by little it grew, thanks to the dedication and meticulousness that she has. Currently Sonia has overcome this; her store is well supplied with products that are basic necessities so that her customers can always find everything. Going forward she is thinking of expanding her business. This is her first loan with MFP, which is why she has committed to settling her repayments punctually.
Sonia is happy to have a united community bank. With the 1,000 nuevos soles she will expand her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to supply her store.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 33 years old, married, and has five children; all of whom attend school.  She lives in Kator. She sells charcoal, which she has been doing for four years. 

Rose is requesting her first loan for 1,500 Sudanese pounds, which she will use to purchase charcoal.  She heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is 32 years old, married with three children. He sells secondhand clothes to earn a living, he has been in the business for 3 years and describes his customers as low income earners because they live in slums. To earn extra income he runs a cafeteria. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy secondhand clothes.

loans.use: To purchase secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 32 years old and is married with two children aged between 9 and 10 years old and she takes care of five relatives. Her business is well organized and she owns her sewing business. She starts her work from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day. She currently employs two people to help her and she has 13 years of experience. 

Jacqueline has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her sewing business by buying various materials and more machines. She plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy her family's basic needs and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To expand her sewing business by buying various materials and more machines.

loans.name: Noreen's Group

texts.en:
Noreen is very supportive in nature. She has got sewing skills and works for her neighboring clients. Due to her good quality work, she receives regular orders every month.
Her husband is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to his passengers.
Noreen is the mother of 2 sons and a daughter. Her eldest son has a business of selling animals while others are studying.
She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy spare parts of his autorickhaw.
This will help him fully repairing his rickshaw and provide better transport services to his passengers.
Noreen is very hopeful that her husband’s business will be improved and he will be able to increase his profits.

loans.use: To buy rickshaw spare parts for rickshaw transport business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 37 years old, married with 3 children. She sells second clothes to earn a living,she has been in the business for 5 years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya,she has been able to improve her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy men's shirts to sell.

loans.use: To buy men's shirts to sell

loans.name: Fozia Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Fozia bibi is 31 years old married woman and by this relationship she has a son who is not in a school going age yet.  
Fozia herself is involved in clothes sales business. She is expert in her business. She buys clothes from different cities and markets and sells to her required customers. Her clientele base is her community people and cloth shop owners. She keeps herself updated about the latest trends in fashion which helps meet her clients’ orders. 
Her husband is a very honest person and runs a scrap business in the market. Due to his fair dealing and good behavior it helps him put three meals on the table for his family.  
Fozia bibi has requested for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her own business. She will invest the loan in buying of clothes in larger quantity of different variety for selling. She is very confident that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to her business. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Fozia bibi”.

loans.use: To buy clothes for clothes sales business

loans.name: Rene Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Rene is 26 years old and is married. He sells various goods such as lotions, soap, plastic cups, biscuits etc. He works from 6 am to 8 pm every day and he currently employs three people to help him. 

Rene is requesting a loan via Vision Finance Company, which he will use to purchase various goods such as lotions, soap, plastic cups, biscuits, sugar, rice, etc. to sell. With the profits from the loan, Rene will be able to save for his future, to reinvest in his business, and to build his own house.

loans.use: to purchase lotions, soap, plastic cups, biscuits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia lives in kator. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for three years. She is 38 years old, married, and has five children; all of them are still in school. 

Julia heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en:
Sugran is 37 years old married woman and by this relationship she has three sons. Her elder son works with his father and helps him in his scrap business. 
Sugran herself is a very dedicated housewife and a mother. She fulfills her responsibilities of a housewife and a mother very well. Besides her household chores, she also gives required time to her decorative embroidery business as well. She prepares beautiful looking embroidered clothes for her community clients and earns good income. She does this work to supplement the income for her family.  
Sugran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will invest the loan in buying of scrap such as used papers, plastic bottles and wooden items in larger quantity for reselling.  
Sugran is hopeful that her husband’s financial status will get improved a lot after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 26 years old and is married. He sells various goods such as: lotions, soap, water, biscuits etc. This is his 5 years in this business and his work starts from 6 am until 8 pm every day.

Vincent has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as: lotions, soap, water, biscuits etc to sell. With the profits from the loan, he will be able to save for his future, to pay medical insurance and he will be able to build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as: lotions, soap, water, biscuits etc  to sell.

loans.name: Shamim Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Shamim akhtar is 55 years old married woman and by this relationship she has four children who all are boys. Her elder son is a motorbike mechanic while the next one has a business of spare parts. The other two are free and don’t do anything. 
Shamim herself is a seamstress. Her work is home based. She gets orders from her community clients and relatives and charges PKRs 120 for a simple dress and PKRs 150 for a designer dress. She has been operating her business for over 10 years. 
In these years, she has obtained good reputation and respect among her clients. She provides best services to her clients so they keep on giving regular orders to her. 
Shamim has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy an electric sewing machine because she has a manual machine now which reduced her efficiency of work.  
She is very confident that the electric machine will increase her efficiency level and helps her fulfilling the orders in less period of time.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.en:
Being the head of the family, Ronaldo wants to give the better quality of living for his family. It is a big responsibility for him to be a father of one kid and as a husband. Ronaldo is in thirties and happy living with his loving wife.
To make a living, Ronaldo engage his self in hog raising business. He is happy that even though he is a disabled person, he can manage the business. He is doing his best to obtain his wants for his family. Ronaldo says that physical appearance is not the hindrance for him to succeed. It is the personality of being an individual.
With the costly hogs feed now, Ronaldo is asking for a loan of P40,000 to buy feed for his hogs. He believes that the loan will have a big contribution to succeed in the business.

loans.use: to buy feed for his hogs.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 32 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are still in school. She lives in Malakiya Yambio where she has had a food stall for the past four years.

Lucia heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This will be her first loan from BRAC, 1000 SDG that she will use to buy beans and rice to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 32 year old, married and has three children, two of whom are still in school. She lives in Malakiya Yambio where for the past four years she has sold tea.

Susan heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This will be her first loan from BRAC: 500 SDG to buy sugar and coffee to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy sugar and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 39 years old a business man, he is married to Margaret a teacher. They are blessed with two children. He has been running a car wash as a primary business and a P.S.V driver for the past three years with the monthly income of KES 15,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff. Henry will use the loan to buy a new engine and buy water pipes for car washing. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to build rental houses in his land.

loans.use: to buy a new engine and buy water pipes for car washing

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila lives in yambio. She sells food stall, and has been in business for four years. She is 33 year old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Leila heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pound in order to purchase beans, onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions for sale.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is 46 years old and is a dairy cow farmer in Nyahururu. He is married to Joyce and they have two children. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the field officers and he plans to use the loan amount to buy another dairy cow. 

In the future, Harrison  hopes to invest more in dairy farming and supply milk to various dairy milk industries and make more income and improve his family’s living standards

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Chebet

texts.en:
Chebet is a married lady aged 39 years old having four children aged 16,14,12 and nine years old.  His spouse is Philip a business man.  Chebet sells cereals and has been in operation for a period of six years earning a monthly income of KES. 15,600.

She is servicing a first loan of KES.100,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to purchase dry maize KES 48,000 and dry beans KES. 52,000.  The profits will be used to educate her children and to repay back the loan.

Her dream is to improve her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase dry maize KES 48,000 and dry beans KES. 52,000.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice lives in yambio. She sells food stall, and has been in business for four years. She is 32 years old, married, and has no child.
Joice heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pound in order to purchase beans, onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase beans, onions for sale.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis Fernando siempre ha visto una gran virtud el poder trabajar de manera independiente, pues así no tiene que cumplir una estricta responsabilidad con un trabajo que sea mal remunerado. Es por esto que desde que aprendió la actividad de la agricultura se ha dedicado a sacar sus cultivos adelante y desde este generar los ingresos necesarios para su hogar. Luis Fernando se encuentra casado y tiene 1 hijo a quien siempre le ha querido ofrecer una educación universitaria, sin embargo, las dificultades económicas han hecho que esto sea algo que ha tenido que postergar desde hace un tiempo. Con el ánimo de sacar su cultivo adelante, Luis Fernando busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de insumos que requiere para poder trabajar en su cultivo.

Luis Fernando espera que de esta manera sus ingresos mensuales no se vean afectados por la compra de los insumos que requiere para su cultivo. Además, espera salir adelante con su cultivo y que este le permita ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas.
texts.en:
Luis Fernando has always seen it as a great advantage to be able to work independently, since this way he does not have to observe a strict responsibility for a job that may be poorly paid.  That is why ever since he learned to farm he has made a living by growing his crops and from this he generates the income needed for his home.  

Luis Fernando is married and has one son for whom he has always wanted to provide a college education. However, financial difficulties have made this something he has had to postpone for some time.  

Wanting to increase his crops, Luis Fernando is requesting a loan that will provide him with the chance to buy supplies he needs to be able to work on his farm.  Luis Fernando hopes that in this way his monthly income will not be affected by purchasing the supplies he needs for his farm.  Furthermore, he hopes to move ahead with his farm and thus be able to offer his family a better quality of life and better economic opportunities.

loans.use: to buy supplies he needs to be able to work on his farm.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 27 year old, married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She lives in Malakiyo Yambio where for three years she has sold fish.

Grace heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This will be her first loan from BRAC: 500 SDG that she will use to buy fish to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 50-year-old mother of four children.  She is married to Alex, who is a driver.  They come from Vihiga town, West Kenya.

Ruth operates a cereals business, selling mainly dry maize.  She has done this business for the last eight years and makes a monthly income of KES 8,600.  She is now taking her fifth loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy stocks of  dry maize to sell. Her profits will be used to provide basic needs to her family.

Her dream is to grow her business through KADET loans.

loans.use: buy maize

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria lives in Yambio. She has a foodstall and has been in business for three years. She is 25 years old, married, and has three children -- two of them are still in school. 

Victoria heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy beans and rice

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina lives in Yambio. She sells charcoal and has been in business for four years. She is 38 years old, married, and has six children -- all of them are still in school. 

Angelina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Yambio. She sells charcoal and has been in business for four years. She is 32 years old, married, and has three children -- two of them are still in school. 

Christine heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her thirds loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Wavinya

texts.en:
Wavinya is 50-year-old business lady.  She is married to Pius, a business man. They are blessed with four children, aged 23, 18, 16 and 10 years. 

Wavinya has been a tailor for the past ten years, earning a monthly income of KES 9,000 which she uses to support her family.
She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully.  She will use this loan to buy clothing materials for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, Wavinya will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop, which will help her improve the living standard for her family.

loans.use: buy clothing materials

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 32-year-old a business man.  He is married to Fridah, a business lady. They are blessed with one child. 

Peter has been operating a motorcycle transport as a primary business and a sawmill business as a secondary business for the past four years.  He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

Peter is applying for his fourth loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use this loan to service his motor bike and buy a saw.  With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his child. His hope and dream is to buy a taxi car, which will help him improve the living standards for his family.

loans.use: service his motorbike and buy a saw

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina lives in Yei. She sells charcoal and has been in business for four years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children -- two of them are still in school. 

Edina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 33 years old and married to Stephen, a businessman. They are blessed with one child. Florence has been selling secondhand clothes for the past three years, earning a monthly income of 10,000 KES which she uses to help support her family.

After being introduced by a staff member to KADET LTD, Florence is applying for her first loan: 30,000 KES. She will use the loan to buy more clothes to sell.

With the anticipated profit from her business, Florence will educate her child. Her ambition is to open a boutique.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 52 years old.  She is a business lady, and is married to Douglas, a businessman. They are blessed with three children, aged 21, 16 and 12 years, respectively. She has been a tailor for the past ten years, with the monthly income if KES 9,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. Emily will use the loan to buy clothing materials for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials for her business

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice lives in Yei. She sells fish, and has been in business for four years. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children.  Two of them are still in school. 

Joice heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Yei. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for two years. She is 40 years old, married, and has four children who are still in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Dino

texts.es:
Dino de 27 años. Convive con Elvira con quien tiene una hija: Micaela, de 9 meses de nacida. Esta joven familia vive en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Yavirironi, distrito de Río Negro – Satipo.
Dino nació en esta comunidad, creció rodeado de personas que se dedican a la agricultura, por eso aprendió esta labor con facilidad. Ahora cuenta con 2 parcelas de terrenos propios en los que cultiva café y plátanos. 
Cuando dispone tiempo, los fines de semana trabaja como jornalero en otras parcelas. Dino es un hombre constante y trabajador por naturaleza.  Hace un año empezó a cosechar el café, obteniendo 6 sacos; para este año confía que su producción será mayor. Por otra parte, su platanal cada 15 días le otorgan como 300 kilos, los que vende a 50 céntimos. 
Dino se siente libre laborando en sus cultivos, por eso continuará invirtiendo en esta actividad. Ahora espera paciente 3 años para que su reciente sembrío de cacao produzca los primeros frutos. Dino recibiría su primer crédito de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Inkani”, se siente contento de tener como compañeros a personas responsables como él.
De obtener el dinero, Dino podrá comprar herramientas de cultivo como: machetes y limas, para la limpieza de sus parcelas.
texts.en:
Dino is 27, and lives with his partner Elvira, with whom he has one daughter, nine-month old Michaela. This young family lives in their own house in the indigenous community of Yavirironi, in Rio Negro district, Satipo province.   

Dino was born in this community, and grew up surrounded by people who work in agriculture. That's why he learned this work easily. Now he has two parcels of his own land, where he grows coffee and plantains. 

When he has time available, he works weekends as a day laborer on other parcels. Dino is persevering and a worker by nature. He began to harvest coffee a year ago, obtaining six sacks. This year, he is confident that his production will be greater.  Moreover, his plantain trees yield around 300 kilos every two weeks, which he sells for 30 centimos a kilo. 

Dino feels free working on his crops, and that's why he will keep investing in this business. Now he is waiting patiently for three years for his recently planted cacao to produce its first harvest. 

Dino would receive his first loan from MFP, so he promises to pay his monthly installments on time.

He belongs to the "Inkani” communal bank, and feels happy to have as co-members, people who are responsible; just as he is.  When he gets the money, Dino will be able to buy farming tools such as machetes and files for clearing his parcels.

loans.use: To buy tools such as machetes and files.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 37-year-old married man with three children.  He owns a tailoring shop in Nandi Hills which has been in operation for a period of 12 years, earning him a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

George is servicing his first loan of KES 15,000 that he borrowed from KADET LTD.  He intends to purchase some clothing materials and sewing threads for his business.  His dream is to prosper in business and be self-sustainable.

loans.use: buy clothing materials and sewing threads

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda lives in Yei. She sells charcoal and has been in business for four years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children -- two of them are still in school. 

Roda heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 600 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Harun

texts.en:
Harun is a 65-year-old a business man.  He is married to Millicent, a business lady. They are blessed with six adult children. 

Harun has been running a retail shop for the past 21 years,  earning a monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family.  

Harun is applying for his fifth loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully.  He will use the loan to add more stocks of sugar and rice for sale in his shop.   With the anticipated profit from the business, he will buy stocks for his wife’s business. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: buy sugar and rice

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 36 years old, married to Judith and has two children. He operates a metal and blacksmith business in Nakuru where he makes and sells metal boxes and other items out of metal.

Alfred was introduced to KADET LTD by one of its existing clients. He plans to use his loan of 20,000 KES to buy more metal to make stove stands and other items.

Alfred’s ambition is to grow his business and build rental houses, thereby improving his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more metal for his business.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is thirty years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are in school. She lives in Yei where she has sold fish for the past year.

Charity heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This will be her first loan from BRAC: 500 SDG to buy fish to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a single lady, aged 29 years, who is supporting her three children, aged eleven, eight and six years old.  She owns a tailoring shop and has been in operation for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of KES. 6,000.

Carolyng is asking for her 2nd loan of KES.25,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to pay school fees for her child, who is in primary boarding school. 


The profits she obtains from her business will be used to pay the loan and to plow back into the business. Her dream is to see her children excel in life.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a single lady, aged 28 years, and her children are aged seven, and four years old.  She owns a shoe stall in Nandi Hills Trading Centre and has been in operation for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of KES. 6,000.

She is requesting her first loan of KES.15,000 from KADET LTD, with which she intends to purchase plastic shoes for resale.  

The profits will be invested back into the business and will help her family upkeep.  She hopes to prosper in business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase plastic shoes for resale

loans.name: Lariza

texts.en:
